page.title: 02Our Area : Housing
page.content: There is very little in the way of habitation in this area. Apart from the northern end of the expanding village of Arlecdon the rest of the population is scattered around the countryside either in isolation or at best small hamlets. Some of the dwellings are farm houses but the majority of buildings appear to belong to people who live in the countryside but travel to the nearby towns to their places of work. As this trend continues there has been a recent increase in the number of new dwellings in the area. Some of these dwellings have been erected on spare plots of land scattered around the area, but two places have seen most development. These are Asby and Murton Park, the latter being part of Arlecdon.
